intro: Cyrtandra cyclopum, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyclopum, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by native bees and hummingbirds, contributing to its ecological significance in Hawaiian ecosystems. Cyrtandra cyclopum is also valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
